title:
Quantum Entanglement, Quantum Teleportation, Multilinear Polynomials and
  Geometry
authors: Juan M. Romero, Emiliano Montoya-Gonzalez and Oscar Velazquez-Alvarado
abstract:
We show that quantum entanglement states are associated with multilinear
polynomials that cannot be factored. By using these multilinear polynomials, we
propose a geometric representation for entanglement states. In particular, we
show that the Bell's states are associated with non-factorable real multilinear
polynomial, which can be represented geometrically by three-dimensional
surfaces. Furthermore, in this framework, we show that a quantum circuit can be
seen as a geometric transformations of plane geometry. This phenomenon is
analogous to gravity, where matter curves space-time. In addition, we show an
analogy between quantum teleportation and operations involving multilinear
polynomials.
